New Zealand's innings saw Mitchell and Glenn Phillips score centuries. This partnership was crucial. India's bowlers took wickets late in the innings. New Zealand finished at 337 for 8.

title: Budget 2026: MAIT seeks customs duty cuts on key electronic components
description: The IT industry body MAIT has urged the government to slash basic customs duty on key electronic components and boost tax incentives in the upcoming Union Budget. This move aims to strengthen domestic manufacturing, improve global competitiveness, and address supply chain vulnerabilities amid rising global uncertainties. MAIT also called for continued support for mobile manufacturing.

Massive blaze at Karachi mall: Firefighter among six killed, many feared trapped - video
description: A massive fire ripped through Karachi's Gul Plaza shopping mall late Saturday, killing at least six people, including a firefighter. Rescue operations continued into Sunday as many were feared trapped inside the complex, which suffered severe structural damage. The blaze, suspected to be caused by a short circuit, has reignited concerns over fire safety standards in the city.

title: 'I chose it out of passion': Google founder Sergey Brin on studying computer science
description: Google co-founder Sergey Brin shared insights on the evolving value of higher education in the age of AI, emphasizing curiosity over credentials. He cautioned against abandoning fields like computer science due to automation fears, noting AI's capabilities extend beyond coding. Brin also highlighted Google's shift towards hiring "self-taught stars" who demonstrate proven skills, regardless of formal degrees.

Walking in at 5 for 2, Mitchell played a calm 45 off 50 balls, rebuilding New Zealand’s innings after early losses and guiding them past 90 with controlled batting.

description: India enters a new era in professional cycling with the inaugural Pune Grand Tour, the country’s first UCI 2.2 multi-stage road race. Featuring 171 riders from 35 countries, it is scheduled from January 19 to 23. The five-day event puts India on the global professional cycling map.

title: 'Bengal ready to topple TMC's maha jungle raj': PM Modi rips into Mamata govt; watch
description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi, addressing a rally in Singur, West Bengal, urged voters to end the 15-year "mega-jungleraj" of the Mamata Banerjee government. He launched development projects worth over Rs 830 crore and flagged off three Amrit Bharat trains. Modi accused the state government of obstructing central schemes and highlighted West Bengal's potential for development.

description: MacKenzie Scott's ex-wife, Jeff Bezos, has donated millions to the Solidaire Network, which funds groups facing FBI and congressional investigations for alleged Hamas ties. While Scott's donations are unrestricted, the network supports organizations like Students for Justice in Palestine. Scott has given billions to various causes, impacting diversity programs and higher education.

description: Steve Smith has dismissed reports of a rift with teammate Babar Azam, clarifying a on-field decision during their Big Bash League match. Smith explained his tactical choice to prioritize a strong Power Surge over a single, which led to his explosive century.  The pair were later seen chatting casually, with Smith confirming their good relationship.

description: Donald Trump's trade adviser Peter Navarro has criticized India, questioning why Americans pay for AI services hosted in the US but used by Indian users. description: Three soldiers were injured in a fierce encounter with suspected foreign terrorists in Jammu and Kashmir's Kishtwar district. The gunfight erupted during a search operation in the Sonnar area, with security forces engaging a group of two to three Jaish-e-Mohammad militants. Reinforcements have been deployed as a large-scale operation to track down the terrorists is underway.

title: Greenland row: Trump rattles EU with tariff threats - why India should take note for US trade deal
description: Trump’s move to impose tariffs on European allies over Greenland underscores how trade measures can be wielded as political tools, regardless of partnerships or agreements. For India, the message is clear: trade deals cannot substitute for strategic autonomy, which must remain non-negotiable.

Together, the allies command 118 seats, but the question of who controls the mayor’s chair, and for how long, remains unresolved.

'Beautiful woman distracts ... ': Congress MLA ‘rape’ theory remark sparks row
description: Congress MLA Phool Singh Baraiya sparked outrage with remarks suggesting rape can follow seeing a beautiful woman and that SC/ST/OBC women are raped due to scriptural interpretations. Madhya Pradesh CM Mohan Yadav demanded an apology from Rahul Gandhi, while the Congress distanced itself, calling Baraiya's views personal.

title: ‘Cautious approach’: After marker row, SEC to revert to bottled indelible ink
description: Following controversy over erasable marker pens in recent municipal polls, the State Election Commission will revert to traditional bottled indelible ink for upcoming local body elections. This cautious approach aims to prevent bogus voting after viral videos showed ink marks being easily removed, sparking widespread criticism and demands for action.

title: ‘He was screaming for help’: Techie drowns as car falls into pit in Noida; here’s what happened
description: In a heartbreaking incident, a software developer lost his life when his SUV plunged into a flooded construction pit in Noida. After crashing through a compromised wall, he desperately attempted to remain on the vehicle's roof, calling for help. However, thick fog obscured visibility, and the delayed response of rescue teams resulted in tragic consequences.

title: Occult ‘human sacrifice’: 3 kill friend, burn body for ‘divine blessings’ in Ghaziabad
description: Ghaziabad police arrested two men for allegedly murdering a friend as part of an occult ritual. The victim, Naveen, was killed and his body set ablaze inside an auto. The accused confessed to meeting a tantrik who suggested human sacrifice for wealth. They attacked Naveen with a gas cylinder. Evidence including the auto and cylinder were recovered.

title: Bill Belichick ESPN Role; UNC Post 4-8" (39 chars). Cuts fluff, retains facts
description: Bill Belichick will appear on ESPN’s ACC Network broadcast of the College Football Playoff national championship game in South Florida. The TV role comes weeks after his first season as North Carolina’s head coach ended at 4–8. Belichick is also focused on recruiting, including adding quarterback Billy Edwards Jr. ahead of the Tar Heels’ April 12 spring game.

title: 'Negative': Why MrBeast 'cannot buy McDonald’s' despite $5 bn company valuation
